entry.title: The European Communities (Iron and Steel Employees Re-adaptation Benefits Scheme) (No. 2) (Revocation) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the European Communities (Iron and Steel Employees Re-adaptation Benefits Scheme) (No. 2) Regulations 1988 (S.I. 1988/538) (the “1988 Regulations”), the European Communities (Iron and Steel Employees Re-adaptation Benefits Scheme) (No. 2) (Scheme Termination) Regulations 1994 (S.I. 1994/141) (the “1994 Regulations”) and the European Communities (Iron and Steel Employees Re-adaptation Benefits Scheme) (No. 2) (Amendment) Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/3182) (the “1996 Regulations”). The 1988 Regulations, the 1994 Regulations and the 1996 Regulations relate to a scheme for the payment of benefits to certain steel workers. Subject to transitional provisions, the scheme was terminated by the 1994 Regulations. The 1996 Regulations amended the scheme, as continued in force under the transitional provisions. The 1988 Regulations, the 1994 Regulations and the 1996 Regulations no longer contain any relevant operative provisions and are revoked by these Regulations.

entry.title: The Cosmetic Products (Safety) (Amendment) Regulations 2012
entry.summary:
These Regulations amend the Cosmetic Products (Safety) Regulations 2008 ( S.I. 2008/1284) (“the Principal Regulations”) to give effect to Council Directive 2011/84/EU amending Directive 76/768/EEC , concerning cosmetic products, for the purpose of adapting Annex III thereto to technical progress (OJ No L 283, 29.10.2011, p.36). The Principal Regulations implemented Council Directive 76/768/EEC
(OJ No L 262, 27.9.1976, p.169) on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to cosmetic products.

entry.title: The Street Works (Charges for Unreasonably Prolonged Occupation of the Highway) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Street Works (Charges for the Unreasonably Prolonged Occupation of the Highway) (England) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Designation of Schools Having a Religious Character (Independent Schools) (England) (No. 2) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order designates the independent schools listed in the Schedule as having a religious character.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order amends, in England, Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (S.I. 1995/418). Part 3 sets out permitted development rights in relation to certain changes of use, the effect of which is that those changes of use are granted planning permission without the need for a planning application.

entry.title: The Bathing Waters (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Bathing Waters (Scotland) Regulations 2008 ( SSI 2008/170) (“the 2008 Regulations”) to further transpose Directive 2006/7/EC concerning the management of bathing water quality and repealing Directive 76/160/EEC , OJ L 64, 4.3.2006, p.37.

entry.title: The Protection of Freedoms Act 2012 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order amends the Functions of Traffic Wardens Order 1970 and the Removal and Disposal of Vehicles (Traffic Officers) (England) Regulations 2008 to make a consequential amendment to the definition of land from which traffic wardens and traffic officers may remove vehicles. These amendments are consequential upon amendments made by section 55 of the Protection of Freedoms Act 2012 to the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 to the definition of land from which vehicles may be removed.

entry.title: The Education Act 2011 (Commencement No. 5) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings the provisions of the Education Act 2011 that are identified in articles 2, 3, 4 and 5 into force on 1st September and 1st October 2012 and 1st August and 1st September 2013 respectively.

entry.title: The Planning (General Development) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order amends the Planning (General Development) Order (Northern Ireland) 1993 (“the 1993 Order”).

entry.title: The Jewel and Esk College and Stevenson College Edinburgh (Transfer and Closure) (Scotland) Order 2012
entry.summary: On 1st October 2012, Jewel and Esk College and Stevenson College Edinburgh will both cease to exist.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (Commencement No. 8 and Saving) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into force further provisions of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups Act 2006 (“the 2006 Act”) and makes a saving provision in relation to the repeal of certain provisions in the Criminal Justice and Court Services Act 2000 (“the 2000 Act”).

entry.title: The Elmwood College, Oatridge College and The Barony College (Transfer and Closure) (Scotland) Order 2012
entry.summary: On 1stOctober 2012 The Barony College, Elmwood College and Oatridge College will cease to exist.

entry.title: The Removal and Disposal of Vehicles (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Removal and Disposal of Vehicle Regulations 1986. These amendments reflect amendments made to section 99 of the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 by section 55 of the Protection of Freedoms Act 2012. They extend the power of constables in England to require the removal of vehicles from land other than a public road. The amendments also make further provision for the case where a vehicle may be removed from land other than such a road.

entry.title: The Policing and Crime Act 2009 (Commencement No. 8) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order commences amendments made by the Policing and Crime Act 2009 to sections 119 and 120A of the Police Act 1997 (c. 50) in relation to information to be provided by the Independent Safeguarding Authority to the Secretary of State which can taken into consideration when determining whether a person is suitable to be registered as someone able to counter-sign applications for criminal records certificates.

entry.title: The Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (2007 Order) (Commencement No. 7) Order (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation further provisions of the Safeguarding Vulnerable Groups (Northern Ireland) Order 2007 (“the 2007 Order”).

entry.title: The Protection of Freedoms Act 2012 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2012

ukm:Subject.Value: PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, NORTHERN IRELAND
RIGHTS OF THE SUBJECT, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: PROTECTION OF VULNERABLE ADULTS, NORTHERN IRELAND
RIGHTS OF THE SUBJECT, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order brings into force various provisions of the Protection of Freedoms Act 2012 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Local Government Pension Scheme (Administration) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Government Pension Scheme (Administration) (Scotland) Regulations 2008 to provide that employees (other than police officers) of the Scottish Police Authority established under section 1 of the Police and Fire Reform (Scotland) Act 2012 and employees (other than fire-fighters) of the Scottish Fire and Rescue Service established under section1A(1) of the Fire (Scotland) Act 2005 are eligible to be members of the Scottish Local Government Pension Scheme.

entry.title: The Goods Vehicles (Testing) (Fees) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations amend Part I of Schedule 1 to the Goods Vehicles (Testing) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 to increase the fees payable as follows—

entry.title: The Wireless Telegraphy (Register) Regulations 2012
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Wireless Telegraphy (Register) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/3155, as amended by S.I.s 2006/340, 2006/1808, 2007/381, 2007/3389, 2008/689, 2008/2104, 2008/3193, 2009/14, 2011/439, 2011/1508 and 2011/2756).

entry.title: The Education and Skills Act 2008 (Commencement No. 8) Order 2012
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 3rd September 2012 certain provisions of the Education and Skills Act 2008 (“the 2008 Act”) as listed in Article 2.
